Label: periventricular hypothalamic nucleus, anterior part
Definition: The anterior part of the periventricular hypothalamic nucleus.
Comment: This seperation is based on the Allen mouse brain atlas.

Label: periventricular hypothalamic nucleus, intermediate part
Definition: The intermediate part of the periventricular hypothalamic nucleus.
Comment: This seperation is based on the Allen mouse brain atlas.

Label: cerebral nuclei
Definition: One of three components of the cerebrum that is a composite structure of the endbrain defined on the basis of origin from the ventricular ridge of the embryonic Encephalon. It consists of the extended striatum and the extended pallidum.
Comment: This was added as a more precise mapping to the Allen brain atlas (as opposed to collection of basal ganglia)

Label: fasciola cinerea
Definition: A small paired band that passes around the splenium of the corpus callosum from the lateral longitudinal stria to the dentate gyrus. The FC exhibits clear anatomical borders with the distalmost region of the CA1.
Comment: This was added as a more precise mapping to the Allen brain atlas (as opposed to fasciolar gyrus)

Label: ventrolateral preoptic nucleus
Exact Synonym: VLPO|intermediate nucleus of the preoptic area (IPA)
Definition: A small cluster of neurons situated in the anterior hypothalamus, sitting just above and to the side of the optic chiasm in the brain of humans and other animals.
Comment: This was added as a more precise mapping to the Allen brain atlas (as opposed to pars postrema of ventral lateral nucleus)

Label: noradrenergic cell groups
Definition: Collections of neurons in the central nervous system that have been demonstrated by histochemical fluorescence to contain the neurotransmitter norepinephrine (noradrenalin).

Label: noradrenergic cell group A1
Definition: A group of cells in the vicinity of the lateral reticular nucleus of the medullary reticular formation that label for norepinephrine in primates.

Label: noradrenergiccell group A2
Definition: A group of cells in the vicinity of the dorsal motor nucleus of the vagus nerve in the medulla that label for norepinephrine in primates and rodents.

Label: noradrenergic cell group A4
Definition: A group of cells exhibiting noradrenergic fluorescence that, in the rat, are located in the Tegmen ventriculi quarti (roof of the fourth ventricle) ventral to the cerebellar nuclei, and in the macaque, are found at the edge of the lateral recess of the fourth ventricle caudally, extending to beneath the floor of the ventricle where they merge with the noradrenergic group A6, the locus ceruleus.

Label: noradrenergic cell group A5
Definition: A group of cells in the vicinity of the superior olivary complex in the pontine tegmentum that label for norepinephine in primates, rodents, and other mammals.

Label: noradrenergic cell group A7
Definition: A group of cells fluorescent for norepinephrine that is located in the pontine reticular formation ventral to the superior cerebellar peduncle of the pons in rodents and in primates.

Label: noradrenergic cell group A6sc
Definition: A group of cells fluorescent for norepinephrine that are scattered in the nucleus subceruleus of the macaque.

Label: noradrenergic cell group Acg
Definition: A group of cells fluorescent for norepinephrine that are located in the central gray of the midbrain at the level of the trochlear nucleus in the squirrel monkey (Saimiri) and to a lesser degree in the macaque.

Label: visceral area
Subclass axioms: BSPO:0000098 some UBERON:0034893|BSPO:0000102 some UBERON:0008934|RO:0002162 some NCBITaxon:9989
Definition: A cortical area between the agranular insular cortex and the supplemental somatosensory area in rats and mice. The VISC is the architectonically equivalent structure granular insula in humans.

Label: parapyramidal nucleus
Definition: A small group of cells located lateral to the pyramid of the medulla in the rat and the mouse that functionally it belongs to the reticular formation of the subcortical motor system.

Label: parapyramidal nucleus, deep part
Definition: The part of the parapyramidal nucleus that is closely adjacent to the inner surface of the pyramidal tract.

Label: parapyramidal nucleus, superficial part
Definition: The part of the parapyramidal nucleus that is located on the ventral surface of the medulla lateral to the pyramidal tract.

Label: Perihypoglossal nuclei
Definition: A group of neurons in the floor of the fourth ventricle, in close proximity to the nucleus of the hypoglossal nerve in the gray substance of the medulla oblongata, all of which contain cells with characteristics suggestive of reticular connections.

Exact Synonym: perihypoglossal complex|perihypoglossal nuclear complex|satellite nuclei|nuclei perihypoglossales

Label: rubroreticular tract
Definition: Nevre fibers that originates in the magnocellular red nucleus, crosses to the other side of the midbrain, and descends in the lateral part of the brainstem tegmentum in the midbrain, and travels through the lateral funiculus of the spinal cord, coursing adjacent to the lateral corticospinal tract.

Label: striatum-like amygdalar nuclei
Definition: A part of the striatum which is primarilly composed of amygdalar areas. The sAMY is composed of the anterior amygdalar area, central amygdalar nucleus, intercalated amygdalar nucleus, medial amygdalar nucleus, and the bed nucleus of the accessory olfactory tract.

Label: medial corticohypothalmic tract
Definition: The main route taken by fibers from the ventral subiculum to the hypothalamus, where they innervate the medial preoptic area, “shell” of the ventromedial nucleus, dorsomedial nucleus, ventral premammillary  nucleus, and cell-poor zone around the medial mammillary nucleus.

Label: prelimbic area
Definition: A region in the medial prefrontal cortex that is dorsal to the infralimbic area important in expression of conditioned reward and fear behaviour.
Comment: TODO: add in_taxon rodentia to this

Label: infralimbic area
Definition: A region in the medial prefrontal cortex that is ventral to the prelimbic area important in supression of conditioned reward and fear behaviour.
Comment: TODO: add in_taxon rodentia to this

Label: bulbocerebellar tract
Definition: A subdivision of inferior cerebellar peduncle that connects the medulla to the cerebelum.

Label: sublaterodorsal nucleus
Definition: A region in the dorsal pons that plays a central role in inducing motor suppression during REM sleep.

Label: supratrigeminal nucleus
Definition: A premotoneuron pool in the trigeminal reflex arc that is a key structure of jaw movement control.

Label: accessory facial motor nucleus
Definition: A small cluster of neurons dorsal to the facial motor nucleus in the pontine tegmentum.

Label: efferent vestibular nucleus
Definition: A small region of neurons in the brainstem, dorsolateral to the genu of facial nerve, that have efferents to the vestibular periphery.

Label: piriform-amygdalar area
Definition: The cortical region between the cortical amygdalar area and the piriform area.
Comment: In the human and macaque, the piriform-amygdalar area is not distinguished from the postpiriform transition area.

Label: dorsal peduncular area
Definition: A cytoarchitectonic area on the medial surface of the cerebral hemisphere rostral to the septum, ventral to the infralimbic area and dorsal to the tenia tecta in the mouse and rat.
Comment: Some authors regard it not as a separate structure but as the ventral part of the infralimbic area.
